Frequently Asked Questions

Answers to common questions about cross-border tax filing and our services.

Do I need to file taxes in both Canada and the US?

If you're a US citizen or green card holder living in Canada, yes ‚Äî you must file tax returns in both countries. Similarly, Canadian residents with US-source income may have filing obligations with the IRS. Our cross-border tax specialists can determine your exact obligations and ensure full compliance.

What is FBAR and do I need to file one?

FBAR (FinCEN Form 114) is required if you're a US person with foreign financial accounts exceeding $10,000 USD in aggregate at any point during the year. This includes Canadian bank accounts, RRSPs, TFSAs, and investment accounts. Failing to file can result in severe penalties.

How can I avoid double taxation between Canada and the US?

The Canada-US Tax Treaty provides mechanisms to avoid double taxation, including foreign tax credits, treaty-based exemptions, and specific provisions for different types of income. Our specialists optimize your returns to take full advantage of these treaty benefits.

How much do your services cost?

Our fees vary based on the complexity of your tax situation. We provide transparent, upfront quotes before beginning any work. Contact us for a free initial consultation where we can assess your needs and provide a detailed quote.
